result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Holden S Monte

records.addlTxt: 10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Holden S Monte in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court for Holden S Monte. All parties appear in person. Court calls 20CF42, 20CF43, 22CF68, 21CF32 and 22CF35. State - all resolved - joint recommendation - 22CF68 is also set for PH but will be amended down to ordinance so no PH will be needed or waived. State - 22CF68 - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC - $500.00 fine plus costs, counts #2 thru #5 to be dismissed; 22CF35 - dismiss and read in entirely; 20CF42 - plead G to counts #2 and #5 as alleged - #2 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - court costs on #2 and on count #5 - $300 fine plus costs, counts #1, #3, #4, #6 and #7 are to be DRI, standard conditions of probation to include: AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no entry into any bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol or THC, take all medications as prescribed or over-the-counter medications in the manner in which they are prescribed or to be taken; 21CF32 -amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with a $500.00 plus costs, counts #2 thru #8 - dismissed; 20CF43 - count #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $500.00 fine plus costs, remaining counts to be dismissed. Cveykus and Monte agree. Court makes sure the defendant knows what is means for a count to be DRI. Court - 22CF68 - dismisses counts #2, #3, #4 and #5; amend #1 to county ordinance of DC - pleads G - finds G - fine of $500.00 - 60 DTP/CO; 22CF35 - DRI entirely; 21CF32 - counts #2 - #8 - dismiss, amend #1 to county ordinance of DC - pleads G - finds G - find of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted - balance transferred to any other balances owed on other cases; 20CF43 - counts #1, #3 and #4 - dismiss, amend #2 to county ordinance of DC - pleads G - finds G - fine of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder to transfer to other cases with money owed; 20CF42 - counts #1, #3, #4, #5, #7 - DRI, Monte pleads G to counts #2 and #5 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 95 days - all cases. Cveykus - credit only needs to be applied to 20CF42. Discussion on that. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Monte withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 20CF42 - counts #2 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no entry into any bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol or THC - even if it is legal in the jurisdiction which defendant is in, take all medications as prescribed or over-the-counter medications in the manner in which they are prescribed or to be taken, costs on count #2 - take bond posted from this case or other cases if available otherwise due in 60 days/CO, count #5 - $300.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted - any remainder due in 60 days/CO, credit for 95 days only if revoked, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Criminal Trespass to Dwelling Jury Instruction
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:04 PM Defendant Holden S Monte appears by video from FC jail with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus appearing in person.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State here for PH and will be proceeding. State calls Officer Marc Nylund from Rhinelander Police Department. Sworn in 2:05 PM. State directs. Proper identification of the defendant, 2:08 PM. State asks to take judicial of bond in prior case with a condition of no consumption of alcohol. Cveykus cross-examines, 2:10 PM. Nothing further by either party. Court finds PC, binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Cveykus waives reading ARGN and enters NG pleas and asks to be heard on bond. Court will have set for JT. Cveykus makes statement and would like bond to be set on all four cases 20CF42, 20CF43 and 21CF32 - would like $250 cash bond on all cases. Court will leave bond as is on all cases. Court questions if officer did field testing or any testing on alcohol. State indicates there maybe a global offer on all cases. Court continues bond on all cases and will have set for JT.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:52 PM Defendant Holden S Monte appears by video from FC jail, in custody with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus appearing in person. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cveykus has went over complaint, waives further reading and asks for PH, waives time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH on 3/31/22 at 2:00 PM and continues bond.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000390,
Payable Number: 48336,
Receipt Number: 22R 000581,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.

09:29 AM Defendant Holden S Monte appears by video from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. Called Agency case 22-0128/22-189 and 22CF35. State indicates will not be pursuingcharges on 22-0128 and asks for bond on that referral to be released. Court so orders. 22CF35 - Court will have State provide a copy of complaint to Monte at the jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Monte understands. State - asks for $250 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record. Court sets bond at $250 cash with condition of no consumption or possession of alcohol. Court questions if he has an attorney on his other cases. Monte indicates he has Attorney Cveykus on other matters and will contact him regarding this case. Court has AIA scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 1:45 PM.
